basic.description: This course focuses on recent advances and outlooks in biomedical science research. Course offerings include but are not limited to such topics as aging, biotechnology, bioinformatics, developmental biology, genomics and proteomics, molecular signaling, neuroscience, and physiology. The general emphasis is on the molecular, genetic and cell biology aspects of these topics. May be repeated to a maximum of sixteen semester hours.
basic.subject: GMS
basic.title: Special Topics in Biomedical Sciences
